title: Add Console Task
body: Add a new task that prints inputs and outputs to stdout. Mainly used for debugging.

title: Fix issue when workflow task generates no output
body: Some workflow tasks will suppress output and not return any elements. This is currently causing a workflow exception.

title: Accept functions as workflow task actions in API
body: Currently, the API requires workflow task actions to be callable objects. The API should also accept any function handle as a workflow task action.

title: Add better error handling around unindexed embedding instances
body:
Currently, the following will raise an exception.

```python
embeddings = Embeddings()
embeddings.search("query")
```

There should be logic to detect the embeddings index is uninitialized and return `None` instead.

title: Add shorthand syntax for creating workflow tasks in API
body:
Currently, the workflow tasks section requires a dictionary for each task. It is often the case that this is a single dictionary with a key of 'action' with a value containing the workflow action string as follows:

```yaml
workflow:
   index:
      tasks:
        - action: action1
        - action: action2
```

This change will add logic to check for tasks that are only strings and map them to dictionaries. In other words:

```yaml
workflow:
   index:
      tasks:
        - action1
        - action2
```

will be equal to the YAML at the top.

title: Add workflow search task to API
body:
Currently, the API has two workflow actions built in to interact with the API embeddings instance, insert and upsert. Insert creates a new index, upsert updates the existing index.

A new API workflow action should be added for search. This action will search the API embeddings instance using the input task elements passed through the workflow.

title: Add documentation on local API instances
body: Add documentation on local API instances and link examples to this new section.

title: Add limit parameter to API search method
body: Currently, the search limit is only able to be set through a FastAPI request object. This works well when running through FastAPI. But the API instance can also be directly invoked in Python. A limit parameter should be available for this case.

title: Update unit tests to limit cpu usage for word vector tests
body:
Recent runs of GitHub action builds have been hanging. The unit tests are spawning a lot of processes for just a couple rows. The number of processes spawned should be reduced for tests. 

The build script should also be updated to add a shorter timeout in case the build hangs.

title: Add workflow scheduling
body:
Currently, workflows are run on demand. This makes sense for data that is dynamically changing. 

In the case where an index is being refreshed from the same input source, a schedule option would be beneficial. While the same could be accomplished with standard scheduling tools like cron, having an option directly within txtai is helpful.

This task will integrate the [croniter](https://pypi.org/project/croniter/) [MIT License] library. A new schedule section will be added to workflows. A schedule requires a cron expression, a list of elements to run each iteration and a max number of iterations to run (will also have option to run indefinitely). 

Schedules will work for Python, YAML and API workflows.

Workflow scheduling is initially targeted for refreshing embedding indexes. Longer term, this will form the foundation for reporting, similar to what is currently found in paperai but for all domains.

title: Conclusion on why zero shot learning is used for semantic similarity
body:
Siamese network-based semantic similarity models are supposed to work better than zero shot based MNLI models.
Can someone please help me understand why zero shot based semantic search is used instead of a finetuned semantic similarity model.

title: Object detection model fails to load additional models
body:
When loading an object detection model with another path, the following error occurs:

```python
if hasattr(config, "max_position_embeddings") and tokenizer and tokenizer.model_max_length == int(1e30):
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'model_max_length'
```

title: Add entity extraction pipeline
body: Add pipeline to extract entities from text using token classification models.

title: Add links to txtai in all example notebooks
body: Add links to txtai in all example notebooks

title: Add social preview image for documentation
body: Reference: https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/setting-up-social-cards/#meta-tags

title: Documentation improvements
body:
Make the following improvements to the documentation.

- Pipeline
  - Add examples of how to instantiate with Python, workflow configuration and API
  - Reference related notebooks in documentation for each pipeline
- Workflow: Better present information in tasks with examples
- API: Show how to connect using cURL, reference related notebooks
- Reorganize examples basic on topic

title: The result of the "embeddings.search()" method has a length that does not match to the input argument limit
body:
I am trying to do a search using a query with the same limit as the input data length, but why is the output data length half of the input data length?

why `len(result) < len(data)`?  

```
def get_embeddings(model_name, data):
    embeddings = Embeddings(
        {"path": model_name, "content": True, "objects": True})
    embeddings.index([(id, text, None) for id, text in enumerate(data)])
    return embeddings

def search(queries, embeddings, limit):
    return [result for result in embeddings.similarity(queries, limit)]

queries = (string)
data = [string, ...]
embeddings = get_embeddings(model_name, data)
result = search(queries, embeddings, len(data))

title: Improve multi-user experience for workflow application
body:
Currently, the workflow application is cumbersome and really only designed for a single user. When multiple users interact with the application, there are a number of inefficiencies that should be fixed:

- Change st.cache to the active workflow vs the application. Workflows should be able to be shared between users and not reinitialized for each user.
- Store data and query as state variables
- Set keys on input fields to prevent duplicate key errors
- Use an st.form for workflow parameters, only submit once user clicks build vs on each field change. 

The application is currently allowing 1 active workflow but that can easily be changed with the tradeoff of higher memory usage.

title: Default documentation theme using system preference
body: Update mkdocs configuration to use a media query to automatically set the default theme - https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/changing-the-colors/#system-preference

title: Update documentation with 4.0 changes
body: Update documentation with 4.0 changes

title: HFOnnx expects ORT provider
body:
```embeddings = onnx("sentence-transformers/paraphrase-MiniLM-L6-v2", "pooling", "embeddings.onnx", quantize=True)```

ValueError: This ORT build has ['TensorrtExecutionProvider', 'CUDAExecutionProvider', 'CPUExecutionProvider'] enabled. Since ORT 1.9, you are required to explicitly set the providers parameter when instantiating InferenceSession. For example, onnxruntime.InferenceSession(..., providers=['TensorrtExecutionProvider', 'CUDAExecutionProvider', 'CPUExecutionProvider'], ...)

body:
Hello! I was trying to translate text for two days. The first day It worked awesomely, but the next day there I meet with ImportError.
Here are the blocks of my code: (_P.S. I'm launching all of this in Google Colab Notebook_)
>%%capture 
!pip install git+https://github.com/neuml/txtai 

>%%capture
from txtai.pipeline import Translation
translate = Translation()

>translation = translate("This is a test translation into Spanish", "es")
translation

And the error screenshot:
![sc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71844829/147755561-b5dd3887-d675-4f83-a782-ff91b3590590.png)

**Could you tell me how to "install "pipeline" extra", please?**

title: Change document/object inserts to only keep latest record
body: Currently, a database document or object having duplicate instances within a batch causes a unique constraint violation.

title: Add pre-computed vector support
body: Currently, embeddings indexes support two ways to generate vectors, transformers/pytorch models and word vector models. Add support for loading externally generated pre-computed vectors.

title: Improve efficiency of vector transformations
body:
Currently, vector transformations are queuing transformed vectors on disk to ensure RAM doesn't overflow. But this can be more efficient with the following changes:

- Pickle each batch instead of each record
- Stream back vectors into a memmap array
- Copy batches back in chunks vs a single record at a time

title: Support SQLite 3.22+
body: Currently, the SQLite database implementation uses a row_number() window function which isn't available until SQLite 3.25. Ubuntu 18.04 and Google Colab only have SQLite 3.22 available, so this fails. The query should be rewritten without using that function.

title: Modify embeddings to only iterate over input documents once
body:
With the addition of #168, index and upsert now add documents into an ANN index _and_  a documents database. This works fine when the input is a list but fails with generators since the input can only be iterated over once.

Modify index/upsert methods to only consume the input iterable once but index/upsert into both the ANN index and documents database.

title: Refresh notebooks for 4.0
body: Refresh notebooks for 4.0

title: Use SQL bracket notation to support multi word and more complex JSON path expressions
body:
Currently, there is no good way to extract multi word JSON keys as well as more complex JSON structures. Use brackets to support this.

Example expression translations for SQLite:

- `[ab cd]` => `json_extract(data, '$.ab cd')`
- `[a[0].c]` => `json_extract(data, '$.a[0].c')`
- `[a[0].c[2]]` => `json_extract(data, '$.a[0].c[2]')`

title: Add support for user defined column aliases
body: Currently, user defined aliases aren't correctly processed. Fix this and add full alias support.

title: Add function parameter to embeddings reindex
body:
Add a new function parameter to the embeddings.reindex method. This will allow preparing data for indexing. This is useful if the encoder is changed or some other processing needs to happen on the data. 

Note that if the function changes the data, only the ANN index is affected, not the database.

title: Aggregate partial query results when clustering
body:
With the addition of #170, SQL queries are now supported in addition to similarity only queries.

API clustering needs logic to analyze queries and combine aggregate function results together. For example, if a "select count(*) from txtai" query is run, the results will have a row per shard instead of one count. 

The following should be handled:

- Aggregate functions: count, sum, avg, min, max
- Group by with aggregate functions
- Order by clauses

The default logic of sorting by score descending must be preserved.

title: Add object storage
body:
Currently, when content is enabled for an embeddings index, it is expected that the content will eventually be stored as a JSON block. This works well for sources with text but not media sources like audio/images/video.

Add a new object storage feature that can be optionally enabled. This will require encoders to convert content into byte arrays for storage.

title: Change pickle calls to use protocol supporting lowest Python version
body: Currently, calls to pickle.dump() are using the highest protocol available, which changed in Python 3.8. txtai now requires Python 3.7+ (#175) therefore calls to pickle.dump() should specify protocol v4 which is the highest version supported by Python 3.7.

title: Add txtai __version__ attribute
body: Add a __version__ string to the main txtai module. This must be updated each release along with the version in setup.py.

title: Add index metadata to embeddings config
body:
#174 adds better logic to derive index parameters based on the input data. It would be good to know what settings were generated to help with debugging if there are issues.

The following data should be added to a new embeddings config "build" section.

- create: index creation time (UTC)
- python: python version
- settings: index settings, generated and/or user-specified
- system: platform information
- txtai: txtai version

title: Update workflow example to support embeddings content
body: Add options for tabular and embeddings to support processing full document content

title: Consistently name embeddings id fields
body:
Currently, there are a couple different variations for the embeddings index id and the unique ids passed in for record ids. This should be made consistent across the embeddings, database and ann packages. 

The terminology should be:

- **indexid**: The internal index id used within the embeddings index. This is the index location within the original embeddings array for inserts. An offset with the current count is applied for upserts. Doesn't mean anything outside the context of the embeddings index.
- **id**: User provided unique record id. External facing APIs will use this.

title: Add content option to tabular pipeline
body:
Currently, the tabular pipeline will create a pandas DataFrame for input data and create (id, text, tags) tuples. A new option should be added to also create additional content records.

The content field can be either True/False or a list. 

- If False (default), no content is created
- If True, all fields available in the DataFrame are added to a content record for each row id created
- If content is a list, the list is used to select only those fields from the DataFrame to add to a content record

title: Update API to work with embeddings + database search
body:
The API needs a couple updates to work with database results. 

- API
  - Pass dictionaries directly to embeddings vs parsing out text field when adding docs. Embeddings does that now.
  - Handle unpacking both (id, score) and dictionary search results.
- Cluster
  - URL encode queries for search
  - The score field won't always be present

title: Require Python 3.7+
body: Python 3.6 is EOL in a week. Update scripts and requirements to 3.7.

title: Update default ANN parameters
body: The current default set of ANN index parameters should be re-evaluated to better work out of the box for larger indices.

title: Add close method to embeddings
body: Add a method to close and free all embedding resources for an open index

title: Add index archive support
body:
Currently, embeddings indexes are saved and loaded to directories. Add methods to support reading and writing indexes from/to archive files. Support following formats:

- tar.bz2
- tar.gz
- tar.xz
- zip

This method will store compressed indexes. Compressed indexes can be used directly and/or as a backup strategy.

title: Add reindex method to embeddings
body:
With the addition of #168, txtai embedding indices can now be re-run through indexing given that the data is available.

This method will:

- Read all database records
- Write the records to a new ANN index with new configuration

title: Add SQL support for generating combined embeddings + database queries
body:
With #168 and #169, txtai now has support for storing full content alongside the embeddings vectors. This issue will add the following features to support combined embeddings + database queries.

- A function named similar() that queries an embeddings index and return ids
- SQL expression parsers that embed similar() query results into a SQL query
- Querying both the standard database fields and dynamically generate query clauses from document JSON

title: Add option to index dictionaries of content
body:
Currently, the embeddings insert and upsert methods take tuples of (id, text|tokens, tags). The text/tokens are then converted into vectors and stored in an ANN datastore.

This issue will allow the 2nd argument of the tuple to be a Python dictionary. The only requirement is that the dictionary should have a field called "text" which will be used as the element's text. If the content=True flag is set (see #168), this will also store the full dictionary as JSON.

title: Store text content
body:
Currently, txtai only supports loading text into approximate nearest neighbor indices. This method will store an id and a vector field. It is assumed that data is externally stored and the id returned by txtai would then be used to resolve records with this other store. 

This change will add a new option. While the default functionality will still behave as above, content can now also be stored with txtai. This requires setting a field named `content` to `True` in the embeddings config. The text field will be loaded into a backend database and will be returned with searches.

title: Add tensor workflow notebook
body: Add notebook showing how txtai workflows can be applied to tensor arrays

title: Process task actions concurrently
body:
Currently, multi-action tasks allow parallel execution against the data but are processed single threaded. This change will enable concurrent processing with the following two modes:

- thread: Multithreading pool. Doesn't help with CPU driven actions due to GIL but can help with I/O bound actions.
- process: Multiprocessing pool. Creates separate sub processes to work around GIL.

title: Make adding pipelines to API easier
body:
Currently, the list of available pipelines and endpoints is hard coded in the API. This should be modified to dynamically detect pipelines within the txtai.pipeline package. This will make all txtai.pipelines available via API workflows. 

Exposing API endpoints for each pipeline still needs to be explicitly set but this change will also make that easier. All that will be needed is a new router class in txtai.api.routers. With this change, the router will automatically be detected and loaded. 

Not all pipelines should be available via a direct endpoint and there is non-trival parameter mapping necessary, so this is a good balance.

title: Read YAML config if provided as a file path
body:
Currently, the API assumes the input config object is already a YAML object. There should be an option to read a file. 

Additionally, the search method should default the request parameter if not provided.

title: Expose caption and objects pipeline via API
body: #148 and #149 added objects and caption pipelines to txtai. These pipelines should be available via the API.

title: Add thread lock around API write calls
body:
Add a thread lock around:

- add
- index
- upsert
- delete

This will ensure that only a single thread ever writes to an Embeddings index through the API.

title: Add tensor support to workflows
body:
While workflows are general enough to work with any type of content, it has been developed with text in mind. A couple tweaks will enable better tensor processing:

- Native hstack/vstack merging: Use numpy/torch methods to run these operations in memory vs zip/list
- Support building batches with slices (#158). Prevents unnecessary copying of data.
- Add merge=None. This will return a list of outputs for each task action.

title: Modify workflow to select batches with slices
body:
Currently, workflows build batches via appending each input element into a separate list. While this is necessary for working with generators, it's more efficient to select slices when working with fixed size inputs. Furthermore, tensor inputs will be processed extremely inefficiently when appending each row to a list vs selecting slice. 

This issue will update workflows to process data in a more efficient manner for these cases.

title: Downloading the same files after every couple of translations
body:
I am translating a large dictionary using txtai:



```%%capture
!pip install git+https://github.com/neuml/txtai#egg=txtai[pipeline]

from txtai.pipeline import Translation
translate = Translation(path='facebook/m2m100_418M', gpu=True, batch=64)


src_lang_dict_items_list = list(src_lang_dict.items())

for k, v in tqdm(src_lang_dict_items_list[latest_count:]):
    try:
        translated_word = translate(k, dest_language_code)
    except KeyError:
        translated_word = k
    #romanised_word = translated_word
    dest_language_dict[translated_word] = v.tolist()

```

title: Update documentation with latest changes
body: Review and update the documentation as appropriate.

title: Add new workflow functionality
body:
Add the following new functionality to the workflow framework.

- Multi-action support: Support an array of actions to execute for each task
- Column selection: Allow selecting a subset of data for a task
- Output merging: For multi-action tasks, add logic to control how the outputs are merged
- Task initialization and finalization: Run a method at the start of a workflow and the end of a workflow

title: Update optional package tests to simulate missing packages
body: Currently, optional package tests only set a flag but don't actually test a package missing. This test should be updated to better simulate a missing optional dependency and have better test coverage.

title: Add parameter to flatten labels output
body: Add a new parameter to the Labels pipeline that flattens outputs from a list of (id, score) tuples to a list of label strings.

title: Add no-op pipeline
body: Add a simple no operation pipeline that returns input elements. This will mainly be used via the API as the same thing in Python could be accomplished with a lambda function.

title: Fix inconsistencies with url based tasks
body: Currently, the UrlTask removes file:// prefixes from file urls. This was done to work best with the textractor pipeline but this functionality should be decoupled.

title: Add retrieval task
body: Add task that can retrieve files from a local or remote location into a local directory.

title: Add image caption pipeline
body: Add pipeline that can describe images

title: Add object detection pipeline
body: Add pipeline to detect objects in images. This pipeline should support both object detection models and image classification models.

title: Reorganize pipeline package
body:
With the recent and upcoming new pipelines, the pipeline directory is getting crowded. Furthermore, it's not easily clear what pipelines work with what types of data. This change will reorganize the pipeline package into logical groupings as follows:

- audio: Works with audio data
- segment: Splits text into logical units
- text: classifies, extracts and/or measures similarity of text
- train: trains new models

This change will be fully backwards compatabile and pipelines will all be available via txtai.pipeline. For example, the following will still work the same. 

```python
from txtai.pipeline import Summary
```

title: Fix bug with importing service task when workflow extra not installed
body: xmltodict was recently added as a dependency for ServiceTask. Given that this library is optional, it should be wrapped as a conditional import. Currently, the entire workflow package can't be imported unless xmltodict is present which violates txtai's policy to only fail when the specific library is needed.

title: Add fallback mode for textractor
body:
Currently, the textractor pipeline assumes Java is installed locally. For cases when this is not true, Beautiful Soup should be used to extract text.

Note that this will only work for HTML. Tika can extract text from many formats (PDF, Office documents etc) and is still the default/preferred method.

title: Add an article summarization example
body: Add an example application to summarize an article. While this can also be done with the workflow builder, an additional concrete example would be helpful.

title: Few shot training with API?
body:
@abhishekkshk68 - Adding a new issue for this question. 

------

Hi David,


How to few shot training with the API?
Example of zero shot is provided, but not sure about few shots training
from scratch.

Thanks
Abhi

title: Reinstalling Embeddings
body:
I installed txtai a long time ago, but ended up not using it, so I deleted a folder it created in my home (Ubuntu 20.04) directory. Now I'm back but this line isn't working for me:

```
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

# Create embeddings model, backed by sentence-transformers & transformers
embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2"})
```

I'm assuming that's because the embedding was located in the folder I deleted. I tried reinstalling txtai but no luck. How can I download the embedding?

Here's the stacktrace:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
FileNotFoundError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_110426/22558196.py in <module>
      1 #from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings
----> 2 embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2"})

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/txtai/embeddings.py in __init__(self, config)
     47 
     48         # Sentence vectors model
---> 49         self.model = self.loadVectors() if self.config else None
     50 
     51     def loadVectors(self):

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/txtai/embeddings.py in loadVectors(self)
     57         """
     58 
---> 59         return Vectors.create(self.config.get("method"), self.config["path"], True if not self.embeddings else False, self.scoring)
     60 
     61     def score(self, documents):

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/txtai/vectors.py in create(method, path, blocking, scoring)
     69 
     70         # Create vector model instance
---> 71         return TransformersVectors(path) if method == "transformers" else WordVectors(path, blocking, scoring)
     72 
     73     def load(self, path, blocking):

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/txtai/vectors.py in __init__(self, path, blocking, scoring)
    112 
    113     def __init__(self, path, blocking, scoring):
--> 114         self.model = self.load(path, blocking)
    115 
    116         # Store parameters

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/txtai/vectors.py in load(self, path, blocking)
    122         # Require that vector path exists, if a path is provided and it's not found, Magnitude will try download from it's servers
    123         if not path or not os.path.isfile(path):
--> 124             raise IOError(ENOENT, "Vector model file not found", path)
    125 
    126         # Load magnitude model. If this is a training run (no embeddings yet), block until the vectors are fully loaded

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] Vector model file not found: 'sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2'
```

title: Create README-Korean.md
body:
README-Korean.md is README.md file translated into Korean.
If there are any mistakes or requirements in this pull request process, please let me know. I'll fix it as soon as possible.
Thank you!!

title: Update example applications to be consistent
body: Update example applications to ensure code/style consistency. Also put hosted versions on https://hf.co/spaces, where possible.

title: Add links to external articles
body: Add links to external articles covering txtai in README and documentation.

title: Add korean translation to README.md
body:
Hi! ! I'm South Korean and I want to help you translate README.md to Korean.
Is it okay to translate your README.md?
Thank you.

title: Add topn option to extractor pipeline
body: Currently, the extractor pipeline is hard coded to always return the top 3 context matches to use as input to question-answering. Make this configurable.

title: Add notebook for tabular pipeline
body: Add notebook demonstrating how to use tabular pipeline

title: Enhance ServiceTask to support additional use cases
body:
Enhance ServiceTask to support the following:

- Batch vs non-batch calls. When batch=true, all elements are passed in a single call. otherwise request are made per element
- Extract section from response
- Support XML responses in addition to JSON
- Refactor so actions are supported like other tasks (see StorageTask)

title: Add tabular pipeline
body: Add a new pipeline that can transform tabular (rows and columns) data into (id, text, tag) tuples. This pipeline will help inserting tabular data into an Embeddings index.

title: Integration with a hosted vector search DB.
body:
Hi @davidmezzetti 

Sorry for the multiple questions!

I was wondering if you have a doc or any suggestions for how best to integrate this lib with a hosted vector search engine?

Best,
Dennis

title: Why does `txtai` do over direct comparison of query & document embeddings?
body:
hi @davidmezzetti 

Thanks for the great library!

I was doing a POC of a few different solutions:
- Facebook DPR
- Raw sentence transformers
- txtai

What I noticed is that when using raw transformers and just embedding all my docs, and the query - the results are (visually) worse that when using `txtai` - I had a little look over the code to see what else is being done, and saw some LSA or topic modelling, I cannot remember now... but anyway I would like to ask to see if you could outline what else is done apart from a direct embedding of doc & query and then cosine sim between the two vectors?

Thanks!
D

title: Multi-labels classification ?
body:
This tutorial seems to be a single-label classification case.
https://github.com/neuml/txtai/blob/master/examples/07_Apply_labels_with_zero_shot_classification.ipynb

Is it possible to have multilabel classification?

title: Update workflow example application
body:
Update the workflow example application with following new features:

- Export YAML API configuration to file
- Run workflow as an API service within the application

title: Add post workflow action to API
body: Currently, there is no clean way to have the final step of a workflow index documents like workflows run in Python. Update the API to detect index/upsert actions and run those as post workflow actions.

title: Refactor registering new auto models to use methods in Transformers library
body: #126 added methods to register new auto models in order to fully support transformers pipelines. This functionality will be available in an upcoming release of transformers. This issue should replace any unnecessary/custom code.

title: Add notebook to demonstrate loading scikit-learn and PyTorch models
body: Add notebook to demonstrate loading scikit-learn and PyTorch models

title: Add registry methods for auto models
body: Currently, OnnxModel has logic to register custom models to fully support pipelines. This logic should be moved into a separate class to make it easy to call.

title: Add parameter to use standard pooling for TransformersVectors
body: Currently, it is assumed that transformers vectors will always use MeanPooling. Add logic to check for method == "pooling" and use standard pooling.

title: Add scikit-learn to ONNX export pipeline
body: Add a new pipeline that uses the skl2onnx library to export scikit-learn models to ONNX. The model outputs should be transformed to match the expected parameters in OnnxModel.

title: Add parameter to return raw model outputs for labels pipeline
body: Currently, the labels model applies either a sigmoid or softmax function across model outputs. Add a parameter to return the raw scores from the model.

title: Fix incorrect import in Notebooks
body: This fixes `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'txtai.extractor'` in the Notebooks

title: Pass model configuration to ONNX Models
body:
Currently, ONNX models have no way to receive configuration. This creates an issue for MNLI models/zero-shot classification as the pipeline needs configuration in order to determine the entailment/neutral/contradiction labels. 

The configuration can be inferred from the Tokenizer path and should be passed to OnnxModel.

title: Improve performance of extractor context queries
body: Currently, extractor context queries run serially. In the case of multiple context queries, this should be modified to run in a batch. This will improve GPU utilization and overall performance.

title: Modify extractor pipeline to support similarity pipeline backed context
body: Currently, the extractor pipeline only supports using an embeddings instance to build question contexts. Modify the pipeline to take a generic similarity instance that can be either a similarity pipeline or embeddings instance.

title: Fix issues with Transformers 4.11.2
body:
Transformers 4.11.2 has caused a couple breaking changes for txtai:

- Update labels pipeline to unwrap nested lists from zero-shot pipeline output
- Modify OnnxModel to return "logits" field as expected by text-classification and zero-shot classification pipelines
- Disable default parallel processing for pipelines which consumes too many resources in low resource runtime environments

Also remove unneeded code in labels.py related to text-classification pipelines and use the HF pipeline directly.

title: Create notebook using extractive qa to build structured data
body: Add an example notebook covering how to use extractive qa to build structured datasets

title: Update labels pipeline to filter text classification output
body: Currently, all labels from underlying text classification models are returned. This should be updated to optionally filter the outputs based on the input labels passed in. This will enable the similarity pipeline to work with text-classification models properly.
